page.title: 02Describing 'The Street'.
page.content: For a year, one of the cottages in 'The Street' has been up for sale. There is a public house called 'The Eight Bells', after the bells in the church. Opposite is a newsagents, called 'Handystores'. Recently, a Pakistani has taken it over. There is a haulage company, and a 'Girobank' post-office. They sell sweets, toys and stationary equipment. There are two rows of owner-occupied houses and 'Bankside', a row of flats and Council houses, after that, there are big houses called 'Foxhole', 'Bull Meadow' and 'Belair'. Opposite is 'Drovers', flats for retired people and some large houses for wealthy families. { }
